organic_results.title: Race, Sex, and Aspirations: Evidence for theRace Convergence'Hypothesis
organic_results.snippet: The ascriptive properties of race and sex in structuring the formation of status aspirations have recently been analyzed and typically reveal that socialization models do not" work" for blacks as compared to whites. A recent interpretation, termed here the" race convergence" hypothesis, suggests that gross SES differentials between races found in most samples yield the greater advantages observed for whites, and that blacks whose situation most closely approximates that of whites will construct aspirations and reach attainments in a similar …

publication_info.summary: FM Howell, W Frese - Sociology of education, 1979 - JSTOR
